overview:
April is a seasoned financial and operational executive with over 15 years of experience working with publicly and privately held companies. Consistently recognized as a change agent capable of building focused teams, responding to changes in the market, and creating a foundation for high-growth companies to build upon, April is often sought out for providing consulting and advisory services for companies experiencing high-growth be it organically or through M&A.

Most recently, April has been providing consulting and advisory services to several high-growth Austin Ventures portfolio companies. Prior to that, she was the Chief Financial Officer for Alterpoint, Inc., a venture-backed network change and configuration management software company, until the successful sale of the company to Versata, Inc., a global IT solutions provider. Before AlterPoint, April was Chief Accounting Officer and acting CFO of Motive, Inc., a publicly traded provider of broadband management software with over $100 million in revenues. Over her six years at Motive, April served in several key financial roles at the company, including leading Investor Relations through the companyâ€™s IPO in 2004 which raised $50 Million. She began her career with Price Waterhouseâ€™s Audit and Business Advisory Services, where she specialized in technology start-ups and early growth companies.

April is an Advisory Board Member for Womenâ€™s Sake (an organization focused on Career and Lifestyle Resources for Women) and has been recognized by the Austin Business Journalâ€™s Profiles in Power. She was also nominated for Austinâ€™s 2008 Best CFO Award.

April has a masterâ€™s degree in accounting from The University of Texas and is a certified public accountant.

Follow April on Twitter @aprildowning1
